projects.title: Job platform
projects.description: A fullstack project with Java Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, React and Bootstrap. The platform allows job seekers to search for opportunities efficiently and provides recruiters with an intuitive system for posting and managing job listings.

projects.title: Expense tracker board
projects.description: A fullstack project with React, Bootstrap, Java Spring Boot and PostgreSQL. Expense tracker board enables user to create an account and keep track of their transactions in different categories.

projects.title: Today's tasks with Redux
projects.description: A frontend site built with React and Redux toolkit to handle global state. The site enables users to manage their daily tasks by allowing them to add, delete and mark tasks as completed.

projects.title: Happy thought API
projects.description: Twitter-style, Happy Thought is a site where users can post thoughts, see other users posts and send likes. What makes you happy? Join and share with us!

projects.title: Weather application
projects.description: A weather application built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Open Weather Map API. Users can check the weather in different locations and the styling changes according to the weather.

projects.title: Movie site with React
projects.description: A responsive movie site using React Router and an API from IMDB. It allows users to view a list of latest movie releases and select a movie to read more about.

projects.title: Cities quiz
projects.description: A multiple-choice quiz built using React and Redux, where users can test their knowledge of capital cities.

projects.title: Music releases in React
projects.description: A music release site that allows users to browse the latest music releases. This is a pair-programming project that my classmates and I worked on, using an API from Spotify, JavaScript, React, HTML, and CSS.

projects.title: Duy Tan
projects.description: Duy Tan is a Vietnamese restaurant, located at Kvilletorget Gothenburg. I created their website using Firebase as hosting and React as frontend.
